results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: [New Zealand Weekly Review. No. 201]
results.brief_description: Newreel items include: 1. UNRRA. Clothes for Europe, loading stores for refugees in Europe. 2. Hastings - Spring show. 3. Temuka - Bailey Bridge in Civvies. Wartime Bailey Bridge erected to help country area. 4. From war to peace - returned servicemen train for the building industry. 5. McKenzie Country - down from the tops.

results.title: You Just Don't Realise
results.creator_credit: Paul Saunders, Philippe de Montignie and Eyewitness News
results.brief_description: In Australia, where there is one vehicle for every three people, road accidents have reached epidemic proportions with 4,000 people dying each year. The trauma of the accidents themselves is only eclipsed by the trauma of the chain of events that follow. Highly graphic scenes of car accidents in this film make viewing unsuitable for sensitive people, and preview is strongly recommended

results.title: Liquid Sun (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Apace Research and Sydney University Television Services
results.brief_description: The production of power alcohol from farm crops, and its uses as motor fuel is causing great interest in Australia. It is a major challenge facing primary producers and could be an economic proposition in many areas

results.title: [Melbourne buildings]
results.brief_description: A compilation of short segments highlighting various Melbourne buildings. ‘Elizabeth Tower Motel’ showcasing the cantilever staircase; construction of the new ‘Allan’s Music’ building; a modern office building; Parliament House; St Vincent’s Hospital; demolition of a building on an unidentified site; footage of the intersection of Flinders and Swanston streets taken from Southbank showing the Federation Square site and surrounds before the Gas and Fuel towers were constructed and demolished; ornamental gates near St Paul’s Cathedral; ANZ Bank.

results.title: Harvie Krumpet
results.creator_credit: Adam Elliot, Melanie Coombs, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, Melodrama Pictures and SBS Independent
results.brief_description:
Adam Elliot’s bittersweet claymation short work opens in Poland in 1922 with the birth of Harvek Milos Krumpetzki - an innocent child beguiled with the world, born to doting and quite dotty parents.

Despite being mercilessly teased as a child, Harvek maintains interest in his surrounds, encouraged by his mother who assists him in collecting wonderful ‘fakts’ about the world. One night Harvek’s life is irrevocably altered when WWII breaks out and he migrates to a faraway land - Australia. In an attempt to assimilate Harvek changes his name to Harvie Krumpet and, in the suburb of Spotswood, begins a new life involving marriage, parenthood and finally, old age.

Winner of the 2003 Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film, and narrated by Geoffrey Rush.

results.title: Australian vintage
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film explores the development of the wine industry in Australia with particular reference to Australia’s international status as a wine producing country. Features an appearance by winemaker and writer Len Evans.
